title: Unknown interface error only when using -f combined_json

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug that shouldn't change language semantics when fixed.

body:
### Version Information

* vyper Version (output of `vyper --version`): 0.1.0b10
* OS: Mac with Docker, using ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10

### What's your issue about?

I'm just starting to experiment with vyper, and playing with the imports I got into a situation where I get a compilation error only when `-f combined_json` is used.

My files are:

test.vy:

```py
import FooBarInterface as FooBarInterface
```

FooBarInterface.vy:

```py
@public
def call_test1():
  pass
```

All these commands run correctly, i think:

```
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f abi ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f bytecode ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f bytecode_runtime ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f ir ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f asm ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f source_map ./test.vy
docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f method_identifiers ./test.vy
```

But this one fails:
```
 docker run -v $(pwd):/code ethereum/vyper:0.1.0b10 -f combined_json ./test.vy
vyper.exceptions.StructureException: line 1: Unknown interface FooBarInterface
import FooBarInterface as FooBarInterface
Error compiling:  ./test.vy
```

### How can it be fixed?

The program should compile (or not?) regardless of the output format.
